author: HAMISH MCNEILLY
title: The last meal for Anna Hill: 'This has ruined my life'
description: Anna Hill hasn't eaten a proper meal for almost two years, and would love to drink a simple cup of coffee. Now, the former nurse may go overseas for a crucial operation to restore her oesophagus.

author: Madison Reeve
title: Surveillance footage disproves Kelowna coffee shop owner's assault claims
description: UPDATE 12 p.m.Castanet News has obtained surveillance footage of an altercation between a downtown Kelowna cafe owner and patron on Saturday afternoon. David Dong, owner of the Blenz Coffee inside the Innovation Centre on Doyle Avenue, approached Castanet this week to share claims that he wa...

author: John Plessel
title: Dine 909: Los Tacos Lokos and Rad Coffee expand in the Inland Empire
description: Los Tacos Lokos has opened in north San Bernardino, while Rad Coffee's new coffeehouse is in downtown Riverside.

author: Kathy Sheridan
title: Kathy Sheridan: We’re arguing over coffee cups while the world burns
description: Slapping a 20 cent tax on a coffee cup won’t slow our extinction. But one thing is certain: the time for climate whataboutery is gone

author: Breanna Schnurr
title: Coffee Briefing Jul. 18 – Musk aims to get a grip on reality using AI; Scotiabank and Xero join forces to support Canada’s small businesses; Shutterstock offers enterprise indemnification for AI image creation; and more

author: Contributed
title: Man charged following alleged racist tirade against Vancouver coffee shop employees (BC)
description: A man has been charged after allegedly engaging in a racist rant targeting two coffee shop employees in Vancouver. Peter Gagen, 57, entered a coffee shop near West Pender and Abbott streets on June 11 and made a racially motivated tirade aimed at two staff members, according to the Vancouver Police...

author: Jason Claffey
title: Prospective Brunswick café owner reconsidering project after criticism from community, lawmaker
description: Raffi Sulahian cited "turmoil, started by one local newspaper reporter who intentionally created an unnecessary firestorm" as his reason for stopping a crowdsourced fundraiser to start a new café at the former Little Dog Coffee Shop.

author: Latika Bourke
title: Meet the Australian who went from food truck to conquering London’s cafe scene
description: Australian food and coffee is the latest installation in Britain’s National Portrait Gallery thanks to Prue Freeman’s rapidly expanding Daisy Green empire.
